meanings.sent1: The little girl let out a scream when she saw the spider.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was filled with the sound of screams.
meanings.sent3: The scream from the horror movie made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The scream of the ambulance siren pierced through the night.
meanings.sent5: Her scream echoed through the empty hallway, sending shivers down our spines.

meanings.definition: To utter a loud, sharp, piercing cry
meanings.sent1: The singer would scream the high notes during the concert.
meanings.sent2: When startled, the cat would scream loudly and run away.
meanings.sent3: I scream for ice cream every time the truck passes by.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the branches scream as it blew through the trees.
meanings.sent5: She would scream her frustrations into the vast ocean, feeling a sense of release.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, sharp, piercing sound
meanings.sent1: The kettle started to scream when the water boiled.
meanings.sent2: The brakes of the car began to scream as it came to a sudden stop.
meanings.sent3: The teapot seemed to scream for attention on the stove.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the old windows scream in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The microphone would scream with feedback if not handled carefully.
